Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi was released in 2004 under President George W. Bush, not in 2009 under President Barack Obama.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the Obama administration agreed to let al-Baghdadi go, when in fact, he was released during the Bush administration.
Understate: There is no clear instance of understating in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no clear instance of the claim faltering at times.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is contradicted by official detention records and reports from experts.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that al-Baghdadi was released in 2009 under the Obama administration, which is not supported by evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no clear alternative explanation mentioned in the claim.
